page.title: 02BARN DANCE
page.content: {Nine or ten years ago there was the first Barn Dance in Shirwell when everybody got together and invited their friends to Shirwell village hall for the dance. There is a band that comes to play the music and there is a bar and buffet. It is orgarnised by the school's P.T.A. and any money that is raised goes to school funds. Barn dancing is very popular in North Devon as it would seem to be in most rural areas. Perhaps some of its popularity is due to the fact that a "caller" describes the dance as the music is playing and so you don't need to be able to dance to take part. The P.T.A. of the school has also made a tradition of an annual 'Disco' for pupils of the school which is also held at the village hall.
